Articles.Content: Saw someone post before about a spaceplane-capable warp ring. That would definitely be cool.
Agreed. I admit I've not checked the updated parts yet. Ring wings are a thing (though real ones tend to be squashed, not circular), so I can imagine a streamlined warp drive that's also a wing.
For space planes it will be a deployable ring (similar to what you see now on the 0.625m drive).

Agreed. I admit I've not checked the updated parts yet. Ring wings are a thing (though real ones tend to be squashed, not circular), so I can imagine a streamlined warp drive that's also a wing.

I come from flight sims so i have learned many interesting things - i imagine a round wing wouldn't be terribly efficient but theres no reason it couldn't contribute to lift, the top and bottom parts would probably need to be shaped slightly diffrently from the sides to make a useful contribution to lift. I imagine hypersonic-re-entry would pose a serious problem though. It would definitely be interesting to design around but, it's definitely not my call.

For space planes it will be a deployable ring (similar to what you see now on the 0.625m drive).

any chance you will make them fit the b9 parts like HL or the SP type parts?

Edited December 3, 2014 by endl

any chance you will make then fit the b9 parts like HL or the SP type parts?

I'll take a look, though it's not on the plate for the first iteration.

So I did a clean install and added karbonite and K+ and was unable to replicate the bug. Will continue to experiment, but I'm thinking that maybe there were files left from the first few versions of the mod still in the gamedata folder.

So I did a clean install and added karbonite and K+ and was unable to replicate the bug. Will continue to experiment, but I'm thinking that maybe there were files left from the first few versions of the mod still in the gamedata folder.

Good deal, and very likely as some bits moved around and you may have had a bad component

I regret to say I found it again. After more experimenting I think I found a correlation. If you activate a drive when there is another ship in orbit that has Karbonite parts (but not k+ parts) your ship's velocity goes to zero. This causes extreme lag and sometimes crashes the game. Will further testing, I found that the warp drive would repeat the behavior even if the ship with Karbonite parts was de-orbited. Resetting the game seemed to be the only thing that fixed it. I'll follow this up with more testing later.

That seems incredibly odd given what the part does, so it's likely correlation not causation. That being said, the likely bit of code causing said sadness is probably some of the stabilization code, so I'll poke around.

That seems incredibly odd given what the part does, so it's likely correlation not causation. That being said, the likely bit of code causing said sadness is probably some of the stabilization code, so I'll poke around.

This may help, it does not actually go to zero when you start the warp drive, it does so once you start to move the throttle and warp drive starts moving the craft.

So more testing and I was able to replicate it without Karbonite or K+ installed. If you have a ship in orbit around Kerbin and a ship around Mun, and you take a warp ship and warp to the Mun's SOI, your velocity goes down to zero. And then it keeps going down to zero every time you throttle up the warp drive. Nothing happens if you just jump around SOI's in a system with no other ships.

So more testing and I was able to replicate it without Karbonite or K+ installed. If you have a ship in orbit around Kerbin and a ship around Mun, and you take a warp ship and warp to the Mun's SOI, your velocity goes down to zero. And then it keeps going down to zero every time you throttle up the warp drive. Nothing happens if you just jump around SOI's in a system with no other ships.

Thanks, now I have something to work off of

Sanity is overrated, not having any is much more fun.

What happens if you EVA a Kerbal while the warp bubble is active? Is it theoretically possible to service the outside of the ship while traveling faster than light? That would be awesome.

Also, is there a way to control how big the warp bubble is?
